entry.title: Your unused Realtime Database 'weblog-683a9' will be deactivated in 1 day(s)
entry.summary: weblog-683a9[Firebase] Your unused Realtime Database 'weblog-683a9' will be deactivated in 1 day(s)We've detected the following issue(s) with your Security Rules:any user can read your entire databaseany user can write to your entire databaseYour Security Rules allow anyone on the...
entry.content:
weblog-683a9
[Firebase] Your unused Realtime Database 'weblog-683a9' will be deactivated in 1 day(s)
We've detected the following issue(s) with your Security Rules:
  • any user can read your entire database
  • any user can write to your entire database
Your Security Rules allow anyone on the internet to read or write to your database. Without strong Security Rules your data is vulnerable to attackers stealing, modifying, or deleting data as well as performing costly operations.

Your database has not received traffic for almost 6 months and has insecure rules; it will be automatically deactivated in 1 days unless your database receives traffic or you update your Security Rules. You won't lose any data, and can restore the database from the console at any time.

If you are not currently using the database, feel free to disregard this email—no action is required on your part. You may be receiving this email if you created your Firebase project in 2017 or prior, and as a result you may have an empty auto-provisioned Realtime Database instance. Again, if you are not currently using the database, feel free to disregard this email.
Pending Deactivation
weblog-683a9
Database
weblog-683a9
Learn moreEdit rules
If you have questions or feel you've received this message in error, please contact Firebase support
Thanks for using Firebase!
This email is notifying you about important service information regarding your Firebase project
Manage your Alert settings
Google LLC
1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy
Mountain View, CA, 94043 USA

entry.title: New: Improve your content with Search Console Insights
entry.summary: Hello site owners and content creators,We’re excited to share with you a new experience -Search Console Insights. The goal of Search Console Insights is to help you improve your content. It does that by making it easy for you,...
entry.content:
Hello site owners and content creators,
We’re excited to share with you a new experience -
Search Console Insights.
The goal of Search Console Insights is to help you improve your content. It does that by making it easy for you, whether you're a blogger or a professional SEO, to get an overview and helpful insights on how your content is performing. Search Console Insights can combine data from both Search Console and Google Analytics and help answer questions such as:
•
Which of your content performs best?
•
How is your new content performing?
•
What do people search for on Google before they visit your content?
Open Search Console Insights
There are a few ways to access Search Console Insights:
•
Select “Search Console Insights” from the top of Search Console’s Overview page
•
Access it directly from this email and add a bookmark to your browser
•
Search for “Search Console insights” on Google and visit our site
We encourage you to share your feedback with us, good or bad, by clicking Share feedback at the top or bottom of Search Console Insights. This will help us improve the product, so please let us know what you think.

Try it out today :)
The Google Search Console Insights team
You've received this transactional email because your site is listed in Google Search Console. You may unsubscribe from this type of message or add partners who should receive messages for this Search Console account
Google LLC, 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway,
Mountain View, CA 94043
Message type: [WNC-20154754]

entry.title: Sangyong, take the next step on your Windows by confirming your Google Account settings

entry.content:
Finish setting up your device table td { border-collapse: collapse; } * { -ms-text-size-adjust: 100%; -moz-text-size-adjust: 100%; -o-text-size-adjust: 100%; -webkit-text-size-adjust: 100%; } img + div {display:none; display:none !important;} /* Potrait for Pixel2 */ @media only screen and (min-width: 411px) and (max-width: 412px) and (orientation:portrait){ .head_cls {font-size: 22px !important;} .subhead_cls{font-size: 18px !important;} .headline_cls{font-size: 20px !important;} .subheadline_cls{font-size: 16px !important;} .cta_btn{font-size: 16px !important;} .footer_address{font-size: 14px !important;} } /*-- portrait for iphone */ @media only screen and (device-width: 375px) and (orientation:portrait){ .head_cls {font-size: 22px !important;} .subhead_cls{font-size: 18px !important;} .headline_cls{font-size: 20px !important;} .subheadline_cls{font-size: 16px !important;} .cta_btn{font-size: 16px !important;} .footer_address{font-size: 14px !important;} } /*-- Landscape for iPhone --*/ @media only screen and (device-width: 375px) and (orientation:landscape){ .head_cls {font-size: 22px !important;} .subhead_cls{font-size: 18px !important;} .headline_cls{font-size: 20px !important;} .subheadline_cls{font-size: 16px !important;} .cta_btn{font-size: 16px !important;} .footer_address{font-size: 14px !important;} } .mobile_only { display:none; font-size:0px; line-height:0; height:0px; max-height:0px; overflow:hidden; } @media screen and (max-width:900px){ .footer_main{padding-bottom:0px !important;} .main_table{width:100% !important;} .subheadline_cls{padding-left: 40px !important; padding-right: 40px !important;} }
Hi Sangyong,
Welcome to Google on your new Windows.
Next, take these 2 steps to confirm your Google Account settings.
Step 1: Privacy Checkup
Confirm key settings and the data Google uses to personalize your experience
Confirm Privacy Settings
Step 2: Security Checkup
Confirm what devices may have access to your Google Account and more
Check Security Status
Want to stay in the loop?
Sign up to receive personalized tips, news and recommendations to help you get the most out of your Google Account.
Keep me updated
This informational email was sent to imyamanhitelnet@gmail.com because you recently signed into your Google Account on your Windows. If you do not wish to receive emails to help you set up your new device with Google when you sign into your account on the device for the first time, please unsubscribe.
© 2021 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

entry.title: Inactive registered OAuth URIs for your project(s) will be removed from Google Developer Console by July 12, 2021, for non-compliance with URI validation rules
entry.summary: Review your impacted URIs in your listed project(s). Hello Google Developer, We are writing to let you know that you have inactive OAuth redirect URIs and JavaScript origins in your Google Cloud project that are not in compliance with...
entry.content:
Review your impacted URIs in your listed project(s).

Hello Google Developer,

We are writing to let you know that you have inactive OAuth redirect URIs and JavaScript origins in your Google Cloud project that are not in compliance with Google’s OAuth URI validation rules.

  • On July 12, 2021, we will remove all inactive URIs that are invalid.
  • On September 13, 2021, we will remove all URIs that are not in compliance with redirect URIs and Javascript origins rules (including formerly inactive URIs trying to become active).
What do I need to do to be compliant?
  • If these inactive OAuth redirect URIs and JavaScript origins are no longer needed, you can remove them from your Google Cloud project. If they remain inactive, they will be automatically deleted after July 12, 2021.
  • If your app still needs to use these URIs, please update your app and OAuth configuration from the Google Developer Console to use redirect URIs or JavaScript origins that are compliant with the OAuth URI validation rules by September 13, 2021.

The following Google Cloud project(s), which has/have registered OAuth redirect URIs and JavaScript origins without usage for over 90 days, and which will be removed by July 12, 2021:

  • Project ID: blog-c227a
    • Client: 1014338909363-4fagm99u4dgbo4a4tpsahttnte6gd1gi.apps.googleusercontent.com
      • URI: http://cal.youre.space/625/mt.cgi?__mode=ga_oauth2callback

If you have any questions or concerns regarding these changes, please review the documentation provided above in this email.

Sincerely,

The Google Developer Team

© 2021 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you about important changes to Google services you use.

text-decoration:none; } @media only screen and (min-width : 0px) and (max-width : 480px) { .flexible{ width: 100% !important; min-width: 100% !important; max-width: 100% !important; } .logo_holder, .logo_holder_td, .logo_right_holder, .logo_right_holder_td{width: 100% !important;} .logo_right_holder_inner_td {text-align:right !important;} .logo_holder_td{padding-left: 16px;} .logo_right_holder_td{padding-left: 16px !important; padding-top: 5px !important; padding-bottom: 15px !important;} .tbl_banner{padding-left : 10px !important; padding-right: 10px !important; } .banner_text_1{padding: 0 20px 15px 20px !important;} .banner_container {background-position:top !important; background-color: #227cdf !important; height:auto !important;} .banner_btn{padding-bottom:20px !important;} .banner_text_2{128px 20px 13px 20px !important; font-size:26px !important;line-height:30px !important;} .bottom_link_container_td{padding:10px 40px !important;} .bottom_link_container_inner{padding:10px 0 !important;} .bottom_link_text_mbl{padding:10px 0 !important;} .outer_wrapper_td{padding:0 5px !important;} } @media only screen and (min-width : 0px) and (max-width : 320px) { .flexible{ width: 100% !important; min-width: 100% !important; max-width: 100% !important; } .logo_holder, .logo_holder_td, .logo_right_holder, .logo_right_holder_td{width: 100% !important;} .banner_text_2{128px 20px 13px 20px !important; font-size:26px !important;line-height:30px !important;} .logo_right_holder_td{padding-left: 16px !important; padding-top: 5px !important; padding-bottom: 15px !important;} .logo_right_holder_inner_td {text-align:right !important;} .logo_holder_td{padding-left: 0 !important;} .banner_text_1{padding: 0 20px 15px 20px !important;} .banner_container {background-position:top !important; background-color: #227cdf !important; height:auto !important;} .banner_btn{padding-bottom:20px !important;} .bottom_link_container_td{padding:10px 40px !important;} .bottom_link_text_mbl{padding:10px 0 !important;} .outer_wrapper_td{padding:0 5px !important;} .bottom_link_container_inner{padding:10px 0 !important;} .social_icons_container_inner{width:210px !important;} .tbl_banner{padding-left : 10px !important; padding-right: 10px !important; } }
Your Google Cloud Platform account has been terminated as of March 21, 2021. Please sign up with Google Cloud Korea.
MY CONSOLE

Hello Google Cloud Platform Customer,

We made several attempts to reach out to you requesting to migrate your account to Google Cloud Korea LLC. All customers with a South Korea address are required to be under Google Cloud Korea LLC. As a result, your billing account has been terminated.

You have an opportunity to continue to use Google Cloud Platform by signing up with your local Google Cloud Provider -Google Cloud Korea, LLC.

Once your unmigrated GCP billing is terminated, your data on GCP will be deleted as set out in the Data Processing and Security Terms (Section 6.2). You are responsible for exporting your data on GCP that you wish to retain before expiration or termination.

Google enables you, in a manner consistent with the functionality of GCP services, to export your data. However, data exporting depends on how you have chosen to store your data.

  • For exporting your data on Compute Engine, you can export/import an entire VM image in the form of a .tar archive. Find more information on images and storage options on our Compute Engine Documentation page.
  • For exporting your data on Big Query service, please see ‘Exporting table data’.
  • For other services you are using, you may find information you need at https://cloud.google.com/docs or contact Google Cloud Support for your questions about the functionality of GCP services.
Need more information or help?

For more information, please read the GCP Korea Migration FAQ. If you have any questions or require assistance, please do not hesitate to contact Google Cloud Billing Support.

Thank you for being a valued Google Cloud Platform customer.
CONTACT GOOGLE CLOUD BILLING SUPPORT
Sincerely,
The Google Cloud Platform Team
DOCUMENTATION
SUPPORT

© 2021 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you about important changes to Google Cloud Platform or your account.

entry.content:
assistant-health
Your project was downgraded due to activity in Google Cloud
Open Console
Firebase is deeply integrated with Google Cloud. Many of your settings, including billing information and collaborators, are shared by Firebase and Google Cloud. Learn more
One of the following actions was performed by a user in the Google Cloud Console:
  • Billing was disabled for your project, or
  • The billing account attached to your project was closed
This action ended billing for your project, resulting in a downgrade to your project's Firebase plan.
Project Downgraded to
assistant-health
Plan
Spark - $0/month

padding-right: 10px !important; } }
Any non-migrated accounts will be terminated and the containing data will be deleted by March 21.
MY CONSOLE

Hello Google Cloud Platform Customer,

As you have already been notified earlier this year, your Google Cloud Platform (GCP) billing account(s) must be migrated to Google Cloud Korea LLC and KRW payments as the billing in your local currency, South Korean won (KRW) is now available. All customers with a South Korea address are required to be billed under Google Cloud Korea LLC.

We noticed that your account has not been migrated to your local currency, KRW. It’s important that you migrate your accounts to Google Cloud Korea LLC and KRW currency as soon as possible, since non-migrated accounts will be terminated by March 21, 2021.

Please note that your GCP resources or your pricing will not be affected by this migration, and will continue to run as usual.

What do I need to do?

Take a few minutes to migrate your GCP accounts, including any free tier or free trial accounts, to local currency payments. All customers with a South Korea address must do so to avoid future account termination.

To migrate your accounts, click on your GCP billing account(s) listed below and follow the instructions in your GCP console (you can find detailed instructions in the GCP Korea Migration FAQ listed below). If you are a registered business, you will need to have your business registration number and related tax information ready for tax-related purposes:

  • Billing Account: 01CDB7-731D1D-74DC29

If your unmigrated GCP billing account is terminated, your data on GCP will be deleted as set out in the Data Processing and Security Terms (Section 6.2). You are responsible for exporting your data on GCP that you wish to retain before expiration or termination.

Google enables you, in a manner consistent with the functionality of GCP services, to export your data. Data exporting depends on how you have chosen to store your data.

  • For exporting your data on Compute Engine, you can export/import an entire VM image in the form of a .tar archive. Find more information on images and storage options on our Compute Engine Documentation page.
  • For exporting your data on Big Query service, please see ‘Exporting table data’.
  • To review other services you are using, we recommend you to check the Google Cloud Documentation or you can contact Google Cloud Support for your questions about the functionality of GCP services.
What do I need to know?

When you migrate your GCP billing accounts:

  • The contracting party of your GCP, Google Maps Platform services, if applicable, will change to Google Cloud Korea LLC as a reseller (with offices located at Gangnam Finance Center 20fl., 152 Teheran-ro, Gangnam-gu, Seoul).
  • The currency of your account will change to KRW. Your pricing will not change.
  • Google Asia Pacific Pte Ltd will assign and transfer your Google Cloud Platform License Agreement and your Google Maps Platform License Agreement, if applicable, to Google Cloud Korea LLC, as Google Asia Pacific’s reseller. Your account information, including your email address and other contact information associated with it, will be transferred to Google Cloud Korea LLC.
  • Google Cloud Korea LLC will issue your invoices.
  • In accordance with local Korea laws, these invoices will be subject to Value Added Tax (VAT).
Need more information or help?
  • Learn more about local currencies and exchange rates.
  • For more information, please read the GCP Korea Migration FAQ.
  • If you have any questions or require assistance, please do not hesitate to contact Google Cloud Billing Support.

Thank you for being a valued Google Cloud Platform customer.
CONTACT GOOGLE CLOUD BILLING SUPPORT
Sincerely,
The Google Cloud Platform Team
DOCUMENTATION
SUPPORT

© 2021 Google LLC 1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043

You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you about important changes to Google Cloud Platform or your account.

entry.title: Updates to Actions on Google Policies: Smart Home and Alcohol,Tobacco & Drugs
entry.summary: AFF Announcement .outlook_query { height: 40px; width: 200px; v-text-anchor: middle;} @media only screen and (max-width: 621px), only screen and (min-width: 360px) and (max-width: 767px) { .mobile { display: block !important } .desktop { display: none !important } } @media...
entry.content:
AFF Announcement .outlook_query { height: 40px; width: 200px; v-text-anchor: middle;} @media only screen and (max-width: 621px), only screen and (min-width: 360px) and (max-width: 767px) { .mobile { display: block !important } .desktop { display: none !important } } @media only screen and (max-width: 621px), only screen and (min-width: 360px) and (max-width: 767px) { h1 { font-size: 18px !important; line-height: 24px !important } p { font-size: 14px !important; line-height: 20px !important } .footer-copy p { font-size: 8px !important; line-height: 12px !important } .inner-card { padding: 0 35px !important } }
 
 
Dear Actions on Google and Home Automation Developers,
 

We're making some important changes to our Smart-enabled devices policy that will go into effect starting Ap﻿ril 1﻿1, 20﻿21. The changes are part of our continued effort to increase the security and safety of our users, bring more transparency on certification requirements to our developers, and support the quality of the smart home ecosystem we are building together.

 

The updated policy will apply to both Conversational Actions and smart home Actions, and will feature updated smart home documentation and language around secondary user verification, guidance on required features, and new requirements for the use of the 'Works with Hey Google' badge and related brand marks.

 

We are also making some updates to our Alcohol, Tobacco and Drugs policy which includes prohibiting the sale of tobacco products on our platform and referencing the brand guidelines for Alcohol related Actions.

 

Thank you for all of the hard work you have put into Actions on Google to date. Please reach out to the Support team if you have any questions.

 

Sincerely,
The Actions on Google Team

 
 

G﻿oo﻿gle L﻿LC 16​0﻿0 A﻿m﻿p﻿h﻿ith​eatre Park​way,
Moun​tain Vie​w, CA 94​043

 

You have received this mandatory service announcement to update you on important
 changes related to your Actions for Google Assistant.
